chapter.title: Options

listitem.para: Penalty: A maximum time is given. Each error results in a time penalty. When the time is up the game is lost. This mode is inspired by the genius "Marioâ€™s Picross" of Nintendo.
Maximum time: In this mode only the time is relevant. You can make as much errors as you like. But be aware: cheating takes the fun out of the game.
Maximum failures: For all players who take the time to think carefully. Only the number of errors counts.
Count time: To get a high score in this mode the nonogram has to be solved in as little time as possible. Errors add some time on the clock.

Quiz mode: In quiz mode each error will be punished with a quiz question. When the question is answered correctly the game continues. If not the game is lost. Currently the questions are multiplication questions. The number range is between 1 and 10 for the first questions. Later the numbers range from 10 to 20. We are thankful for ideas about new types of quizzes. Please send ideas to info@freenono.org .
Pen and paper: For all who like to solve nonograms on paper. The nonogram can be marked without rules. To win the game, each and every field has to be correctly marked.

chapter.para: Aside from the game modes more options can be set in this dialog. E.g. if the game board should be shown while game is paused or if wrongly marked fields should automatically be filled with an X.
chapter.important: All options in the tab "game" will not be used until a new nonogram is chosen or the current nonogram is started again. For a change of the program language the program has to be restarted.
